intro: Barringtonia denticulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lantern tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive lantern-shaped flowers that hang from the branches. The leaves are narrow and serrated, contributing to its common name. The plant produces woody fruits that split open to release seeds, a feature typical of the genus Barringtonia. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
